channel.title: Looking to upgrade video card. Need help
channel.description:
Well, I got a old computer, But no money for a new one.. I got a emachine t2892. I've upgraded the ram from 512mb to 2gb. Uhm, The power supply is 300W's.. And I want to buy a video card from newegg.com... I want the video card to at least run CoD4.. And to be about $50.
I don't know much about hardware.. so can you tell me if this would work?
CoD4 video card must be Nvvidia Geforce 6600 or better or ATI Radeon 9800Pro or better...
It must be AGP, Don't think there are PCI express slots on here..
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814131070

item.title: Looking to upgrade video card. Need help
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:6, topic:270046”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=356434.msg2726813#msg2726813 date=1238427679]

It must be AGP, Don’t think there are PCI express slots on here…

From my research it looks like the motherboard (AU31) has 3 PCI ports! You can remove your modem if you dont have any spare.

Open up your PC and actualty check.
[/quote]

PCI-E is different to PCI.[/quote]
PCI-E 8/16x
AGP 2/4/8x
PCI 1x

Read full topic

is better
[/quote]
That’s a piece of shit, but it might run cod4 on a low resolution @ low-medium detail. GL Finding anything better for that price and being AGP.[/quote]
well he said $50

best AGP you could get and would play most games well would be a 3850 but thats $120 dollars
